intro: Anticoryne melanosperma, commonly known as the black-seeded corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its seeds are dark and numerous, often found in clusters within the dried seed pods. Anticoryne melanosperma is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates.
